Here is were you guys lost my good review. We asked several times to be moved to the outdoor area, we were at the restaurant for about 3 maybe 4 hours. We were flat out denied ( we were even forced to make a reservation earlier than we wanted because they told us it was ‚Äúfully booked‚Äù) the restaurant was at about 30% capacity basically the entire time we were there and we were forced to come in earlier than we wanted; the restaurant never got more than 50% full and im being extremely generous with that estimate. so I felt as though what we were told regarding it being booked to capacity was clearly a lie. Our waiter was great (we tipped him well it wasn‚Äôt his fault) and if it wasn‚Äôt for being continuously denied to sit on the deck while keeping the entire area empty the entire afternoon I would of rated it higher, I couldn‚Äôt shake the feeling that this was race related because I watched them seat other people in a couple outdoor tables and they all had something in common that we didn‚Äôt have, blonde hair and white skin.

i would say the spot next door also has a gorgeous vibe and are much more accommodating. We will sadly not be returning to ATIK.

please speak to your staff about this, and remind them that having your body done doesn‚Äôt entitle you to be a snob while you are working. your restaurant has alot of potential but service is key when fine dining and your staff failed horribly at that.  i don‚Äôt enjoy leaving negative reviews but that experience deserved a review.

Brand new restaurant on City Island in the Bronx, has a very upscale vibe to it, the staff was good, very attentive. Service was a little slow, but probably due to being a new restaurant. The first thing that was impressive was the menu is on a iPad, gives you nice pictures of each item on the menu. They will offer you bottled water, Still or Sparkling, we had the Still Water and it‚Äôs $9.36 a bottle. We had the Crab Cake as an appetizer it was okay but not worth $25. One entree was Berkshire Pork Chop, the menu on the iPad shows it with vegetables and potatoes, but was only served with roasted fingerling potatoes, which was excellent and so was the Pork Chop, other entree was Broiled Lobster, which was not on the menu, but I saw it with other fish when you walk into the restaurant area. It was to be served with Squid Ink Linguine, but I asked for a side of Saut√©ed Spinach instead. Weird thing, when the whole lobster was served, the Saut√©ed Spinach was on top of the lobster, when I took the spinach off of the lobster, there was very little lobster meat on the tail, the claws had MUCH more meat then the tail. The Lobster dinner was $75 for what I assumed was a 1.5oz lobster. Wife offered a Dirty Martini and it wasn‚Äôt that great, it was missing the olive brine $18. I had 3 Peroni Beers, $9.36 each. Be aware of he service charge automatically added to the bill as well as the 8.875% sales tax.
$310 for a dinner for two with a few cocktails.

Small Mediterranean escape right in City Island‚Äôs backyard. Nice vibe for celebrations, date night or catching up with a group.

FOOD: Tasty but not outstanding, overall. Portions are also on the smaller side. I ordered the Scallops dish, came on a bed of risotto. Scallops were decent, had a nice salted sear on the top, risotto was okay. My boyfriend got the filet mignon - had a nice char on the top, and tender and buttery. We also had the meatball as an appetizer which was alright.

DRINKS: I ordered the Clam Digger (refreshing, not really super strong) and my boyfriend ordered the One Night in Mykonos (Henny forward, will do the job).

AMBIANCE: Gives an upscale edge. People come dressed up for a night out kind of vibe.  As someone who‚Äôs been to Greece, this spot definitely picked up the Mediterranean vibe with the white and blue walls and nautical decor. The patio our back is also overlooking the water so you don‚Äôt really feel like you‚Äôre in city island. The really paid attention to the aesthetic here.

SERVICE: It does get really busy here, highly recommended making a reservation and calling ahead if you want to try to sit at the bar. They seem to go above and beyond for guests and want  you to have an experience. They even offer a bag/hat rack to put by your table and hold your things.

Overall, I‚Äôd come back. Try to get a seat at the bar overlooking the patio and water. Or a table closest to it. They also have live performances with dancers so it‚Äôs a nice touch.
